page.title: 07FARMING IN THE GLEN
page.content: {Today farming}in the mountains and hills is{very difficult.}The farmer has to feed the sheep on treacle and nuts for the{winter months}from {January to May.}The lambing starts about 8th April and ends about mid_may. After the lambing the lambs have to be kept healthy until they can eat grass. Pet lambs are a nusiance and we try to have as few as possible. Sheep have a lot of{diseases}but {penicillen}cures the most of them. After the lambs are cared for the {clipping comes.}It is long and tiring job. Every sheep has to be clipped . Then comes the{dipping.}All the sheep are put into a big pen, put into the dipper one by one and plunged two or three times. In Autumn{lambs are sold {.Some}go to the grader.All the nice lambs go to the local sales.
